title: James Neilson (footballer)
text:
James Hadden Neilson (7 November 1887 – 28 October 1917) was a Scottish professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> who played in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish League</a> for <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a>.
Personal life.
Neilson served in the <a href="Lovat%20Scouts">Lovat Scouts</a> and the <a href="Queen%27s%20Own%20Cameron%20Highlanders">Queen's Own Cameron Highlanders</a> during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a> and was holding the rank of <a href="sergeant">sergeant</a> when he was killed in <a href="Greece%20during%20World%20War%20I">Greece</a> during the <a href="Salonika%20Campaign">Salonika Campaign</a> on 28 October 1917. He was buried in Kirechkoi-Hortakoi Military Cemetery, near <a href="Exochi%2C%20Thessaloniki">Exochi</a>. His brothers Rolland and <a href="Charles%20Neilson">Charles</a> (the latter also a footballer) were also killed during the war.
Honours.
Aberdeen
